revised_title: Quasi-Steady Structures in the Two-Dimensional Initiation of Detonations
tldr: This article examines the transient phenomena that occur in the first few microseconds after an incident shock reflection in a shock tube. The authors use numerical simulations to study the interaction between the dynamics and chemistry of a reactive gas mixture, leading to the formation of quasi-steady structures, such as weak detonations and fast flames. These findings contribute to the understanding of detonation initiation processes.
